result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert D McCaigue was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with RWR f/w dob 7/26/48 or her residence.   Defendant shall not go on the premises at Shell Station, Theresa WI.   Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.

12:57 - Defendant Robert D McCaigue in court, in custody with attorney Jessica Marie Moeller (eligible).  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, waiving time limits. Court enters Not Gulity plea. Prelim set. Court sets $250 Cash bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with victims RWR dob 7/26/48 f/w or her residence.    Defendant shall not go on the premises at Shell Station, Theresa WI. The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.   Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 11, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
